hanzi-su-wiki:
込

Значения

Быть переполненным; включать, вкладывать

Мнемоника

  • Японский иероглиф. Корни, входящие 入 в землю. Элемент «движение» 辶 усиливает основной смысл — вводить.

  • "Много людей идут в палатку (как 入). Она уже переполнена."
purpleculture_pinyin:
xx
(Japanese kokuji) to be crowded; to go into
(Японский кокудзи) быть многолюдным; перейти в
rtega_mnemonic:
込込RScrowd into, go into
  • go ⻌ enter 入; if everybody does it, the place becomes crowded
迂
koohiiStory1: During a traffic jam it is impossible to get your car to enter the roadway as it is crowded with cars. Think of a grid lock so bad cars are litterally scraping up against each other like people on a Japanese train during rush hour.
koohiiStory2: Everybody tries to enter the road during rush hour. That´s why it´s so crowded.
kunYomi: こ.み、 -こ.み、 -こ.む、 こ.む、 こ.める
jp_example_words:
意気込む(いきごむ): to be enthusiastic about
打ち込む(うちこむ): to drive in (e.g. nail stake), to devote oneself to, to shoot into, to smash, to throw into, to cast into
埋め込む(うめこむ): to bury
追い込む(おいこむ): to herd, to corner, to drive
押し込む(おしこむ): to push into, to crowd into
落ち込む(おちこむ): to fall into, to feel down (sad)
組み込む(くみこむ): to insert, to include, to cut in (printing)
込める(こめる): to include, to put into
飲み込む(のみこむ): to gulp down, to swallow deeply, to understand, to take in, to catch on to, to learn, to digest
乗り込む(のりこむ): to board, to embark on, to get into (a car), to ship (passengers), to man (a ship), to help (someone) into, to march into, to enter
放り込む(ほうりこむ): to throw into
見込み(みこみ): hope, prospects, expectation
申し込み(もうしこみ): application, entry, request, subscription, offer, proposal, overture, challenge
割り込む(わりこむ): to cut in, to thrust oneself into, to wedge oneself in, to muscle in on, to interrupt, to disturb
思い込む(おもいこむ): be under impression that, be convinced that, imagine that, set one´s heart on, be bent on
突っ込む(つっこむ): thrust something into something, plunge into, go into deeply, meddle, interfere
溶け込む(とけこむ): melt into
飛び込む(とびこむ): jump in, leap in, plunge into, dive
払い込む(はらいこむ): deposit, pay in
引っ込む(ひっこむ): draw back, sink, cave in
人込み(ひとごみ): crowd of people
申し込む(もうしこむ): apply for, propose, offer, challenge, request
込む(こむ): be crowded
jp_readingExamples: 込む (こ.む), 込める (こ.める)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A scooter sits at the entrance where people enter. You jump on and are flung inside! Because a lot of other people did the same thing, it's really crowded in here.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine going to your favorite store. There's a scooter on and waiting at the entrance. You can't see inside, so when you are scooted inside by the scooter, you just get thrown into a packed room. So many other people on scooters! It's too crowded!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Whoever came up with the scooter entrance idea, that made your favorite store so crowded? Only a 子 (こ) could come up with something like this. They don't really think about the dangers and legal implications of using a scooter to launch people into a crowded space.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine a 子 at the head of a huge conference table. "I know how to make our stores crowded again!" they shout before showing everyone their plan drawn in Crayons.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you move (⻌) to enter (入) but it's crowded

込

Значения

Быть переполненным; включать, вкладывать

Мнемоника

  • Японский иероглиф. Корни, входящие 入 в землю. Элемент «движение» 辶 усиливает основной смысл — вводить.

  • "Много людей идут в палатку (как 入). Она уже переполнена."
Radicals: 入  (enter, scooter)
Meaning Mnemonic
A scooter sits at the entrance where people enter. You jump on and are flung inside! Because a lot of other people did the same thing, it's really crowded in here.
Imagine going to your favorite store. There's a scooter on and waiting at the entrance. You can't see inside, so when you are scooted inside by the scooter, you just get thrown into a packed room. So many other people on scooters! It's too crowded!
Reading Mnemonic
Whoever came up with the scooter entrance idea, that made your favorite store so crowded? Only a 子 (こ) could come up with something like this. They don't really think about the dangers and legal implications of using a scooter to launch people into a crowded space.
Imagine a 子 at the head of a huge conference table. "I know how to make our stores crowded again!" they shout before showing everyone their plan drawn in Crayons.
